capsules_submitted.utterance: Snape's affiliation with Hogwarts is a well-documented fact. capsules_submitted.utterance: I'm not really sure I'd say Snape is affiliated with Hogwarts, to be honest. He was a teacher there, but his methods were often pretty... questionable. I mean, the way he treated Harry Potter, for example, was just cruel. But at the same time, I think Snape did have a certain loyalty to the school, even if it wasn't always clear-cut.

Snape's affiliation with Hogwarts is a bit complicated, to be honest. I mean, he was the Potions master for many years and seemed to have a certain... respect for the school, but at the same time, his behavior towards students, especially Harry Potter, was often quite harsh and intimidating. I think it's safe to say that Snape's loyalty was ultimately to Hogwarts, but not necessarily in the way you might expect.

capsules_submitted.utterance: Snape's affiliation with Hogwarts is a bit complicated, to be honest. I mean, he was the Potions master for many years and had a significant impact on the students' education, but at the same time, his behavior towards Harry Potter and other students was often quite... intimidating. He seemed to have a personal vendetta against Harry, which made it difficult for me to see him as just another teacher. I think his past experiences and relationships played a big role in shaping his views on Hogwarts and its students.
